content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
{'role': 'system', 'content': 'This reminds you of these events from your past: \nAs the system, I remind myself that the user generated an image of top travel destinations and saved the top attractions to a file named "top_attractions.txt". The user then used the command "read_file" to retrieve the content of the file and "google" to search for Machu Picchu. As the user\'s computer, I returned a list of links related to Machu Picchu and the user used the command "browse_website" to visit the Wikipedia page for Machu Picchu and ask "What is Machu Picchu?"'}
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[{'role': 'your computer', 'content': "Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: Machu Picchu is an ancient Inca citadel located in the Andes Mountains of Peru. It was built in the 15th century and was abandoned during the Spanish conquest. The site was rediscovered in 1911 by Hiram Bingham and has since become a popular tourist destination and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is known for its impressive architecture, stunning natural surroundings, and the fact that it was built on major fault zones. The site features an urban and agricultural sector, with temples, warehouses, and a residential district. Machu Picchu was constructed as an estate for the Inca emperor Pachacuti and is believed to have been a religious and political center. The Incas built the estate around 1450 but abandoned it a century later. Today, Machu Picchu is a popular tourist destination, visited by thousands of tourists each year. \n \n Links: ['Jump to content (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Machu_Picchu#bodyContent)', 'Main page (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page)', 'Contents (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Contents)', 'Current events (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portal:Current_events)', 'Random article (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Random)']"}, {'role': 'you', 'content': '{"command": {"name": "write_to_file", "args": {"filename": "machu_picchu.txt", "text": "Machu Picchu is an ancient Inca citadel located in the Andes Mountains of Peru. It was built in the 15th century and was abandoned during the Spanish conquest. The site was rediscovered in 1911 by Hiram Bingham and has since become a popular tourist destination and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is known for its impressive architecture, stunning natural surroundings, and the fact that it was built on major fault zones. The site features an urban and agricultural sector, with temples, warehouses, and a residential district. Machu Picchu was constructed as an estate for the Inca emperor Pachacuti and is believed to have been a religious and political center. The Incas built the estate around 1450 but abandoned it a century later. Today, Machu Picchu is a popular tourist destination, visited by thousands of tourists each year."}}}'}]
"""
